mods.abstract: Ozarkana Corners radio show (sometimes spelled 'Ozarkanna'), part 1. Likely broadcast by KWTO, Springfield, MO, circa late 1930s (by 1940 the show had been renamed The Little Crossroads Store). Featuring announcer Bill Ring, host Squint Thompson (played by George Earle Wilson), co-host Chuck Wagner (played by Al Stone), Slim Pickens Wilson, Penny Nichols, Flash & Whistler, the Matthews Quartet, Chuck Bowers, the Tall Timber Boys, Lou Black, Zed Tennis, and 'Midnight' (character possibly played by George Earle Wilson).

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
